trans-unit.source: Stored procedures in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Stored procedures in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for implementing stored procedures in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for implementing stored procedures in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Stored procedures in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Stored procedures in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse supports many of the Transact-SQL features found in SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse supports many of the Transact-SQL features found in SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: More importantly there are scale out specific features that we will want to leverage to maximize the performance of your solution.
trans-unit.target: More importantly there are scale out specific features that we will want to leverage to maximize the performance of your solution.

trans-unit.source: However, to maintain the scale and performance of SQL Data Warehouse there are also some features and functionality that have behavioral differences and others that are not supported.
trans-unit.target: However, to maintain the scale and performance of SQL Data Warehouse there are also some features and functionality that have behavioral differences and others that are not supported.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to implement stored procedures within SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to implement stored procedures within SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: Introducing stored procedures
trans-unit.target: Introducing stored procedures

trans-unit.source: Stored procedures are a great way for encapsulating your SQL code; storing it close to your data in the data warehouse.
trans-unit.target: Stored procedures are a great way for encapsulating your SQL code; storing it close to your data in the data warehouse.

trans-unit.source: By encapsulating the code into manageable units stored procedures help developers modularize their solutions; facilitating greater re-usability of code.
trans-unit.target: By encapsulating the code into manageable units stored procedures help developers modularize their solutions; facilitating greater re-usability of code.

trans-unit.source: Each stored procedure can also accept parameters to make them even more flexible.
trans-unit.target: Each stored procedure can also accept parameters to make them even more flexible.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse provides a simplified and streamlined stored procedure implementation.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse provides a simplified and streamlined stored procedure implementation.

trans-unit.source: The biggest difference compared to SQL Server is that the stored procedure is not pre-compiled code.
trans-unit.target: The biggest difference compared to SQL Server is that the stored procedure is not pre-compiled code.

trans-unit.source: In data warehouses we are generally less concerned with the compilation time.
trans-unit.target: In data warehouses we are generally less concerned with the compilation time.

trans-unit.source: It is more important that the stored procedure code is correctly optimised when operating against large data volumes.
trans-unit.target: It is more important that the stored procedure code is correctly optimised when operating against large data volumes.

trans-unit.source: The goal is to save hours, minutes and seconds not milliseconds.
trans-unit.target: The goal is to save hours, minutes and seconds not milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: It is therefore more helpful to think of stored procedures as containers for SQL logic.
trans-unit.target: It is therefore more helpful to think of stored procedures as containers for SQL logic.

trans-unit.source: When SQL Data Warehouse executes your stored procedure the SQL statements are parsed, translated and optimized at run time.
trans-unit.target: When SQL Data Warehouse executes your stored procedure the SQL statements are parsed, translated and optimized at run time.

trans-unit.source: During this process each statement is converted into distributed queries.
trans-unit.target: During this process each statement is converted into distributed queries.

trans-unit.source: The SQL code that is actually executed against the data is different to the query submitted.
trans-unit.target: The SQL code that is actually executed against the data is different to the query submitted.

trans-unit.source: Nesting stored procedures
trans-unit.target: Nesting stored procedures

trans-unit.source: When stored procedures call other stored procedures or execute dynamic sql then the inner stored procedure or code invocation is said to be nested.
trans-unit.target: When stored procedures call other stored procedures or execute dynamic sql then the inner stored procedure or code invocation is said to be nested.

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse support a maximum of 8 nesting levels.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse support a maximum of 8 nesting levels.

trans-unit.source: This is slightly different to SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: This is slightly different to SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: The nest level in SQL Server is 32.
trans-unit.target: The nest level in SQL Server is 32.

trans-unit.source: The top level stored procedure call equates to nest level 1
trans-unit.target: The top level stored procedure call equates to nest level 1

trans-unit.source: If the stored procedure also makes another EXEC call then this will increase the nest level to 2
trans-unit.target: If the stored procedure also makes another EXEC call then this will increase the nest level to 2

trans-unit.source: If the second procedure then executes some dynamic sql then this will increase the nest level to 3
trans-unit.target: If the second procedure then executes some dynamic sql then this will increase the nest level to 3

trans-unit.source: Note SQL Data Warehouse does not currently support @@NESTLEVEL.
trans-unit.target: Note SQL Data Warehouse does not currently support @@NESTLEVEL.

trans-unit.source: You will need to keep a track of your nest level yourself.
trans-unit.target: You will need to keep a track of your nest level yourself.

trans-unit.source: It is unlikely you will hit the 8 nest level limit but if you do you will need to re-work your code and "flatten" it so that it fits within this limit.
trans-unit.target: It is unlikely you will hit the 8 nest level limit but if you do you will need to re-work your code and "flatten" it so that it fits within this limit.

trans-unit.source: INSERT..EXECUTE
trans-unit.target: INSERT..EXECUTE

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse does not permit you to consume the result set of a stored procedure with an INSERT statement.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse does not permit you to consume the result set of a stored procedure with an INSERT statement.

trans-unit.source: However, there is an alternative approach you can use.
trans-unit.target: However, there is an alternative approach you can use.

trans-unit.source: Please refer to the following article on [temporary tables] for an example on how to do this.
trans-unit.target: Please refer to the following article on [temporary tables] for an example on how to do this.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: There are some aspects of Transact-SQL stored procedures that are not implemented in SQL Data Warehouse.
trans-unit.target: There are some aspects of Transact-SQL stored procedures that are not implemented in SQL Data Warehouse.

trans-unit.source: They are:
trans-unit.target: They are:

trans-unit.source: temporary stored procedures
trans-unit.target: temporary stored procedures

trans-unit.source: numbered stored procedures
trans-unit.target: numbered stored procedures

trans-unit.source: extended stored procedures
trans-unit.target: extended stored procedures

trans-unit.source: CLR stored procedures
trans-unit.target: CLR stored procedures

trans-unit.source: encryption option
trans-unit.target: encryption option

trans-unit.source: replication option
trans-unit.target: replication option

trans-unit.source: table-valued parameters
trans-unit.target: table-valued parameters

trans-unit.source: read-only parameters
trans-unit.target: read-only parameters

trans-unit.source: default parameters
trans-unit.target: default parameters

trans-unit.source: execution contexts
trans-unit.target: execution contexts

trans-unit.source: return statement
trans-unit.target: return statement
